Admissions

At Beckminster Crest, our admissions process is designed to be welcoming, transparent, and thoughtful, ensuring each prospective student is given the opportunity to shine. Entry typically involves an age-appropriate assessment or entrance examination, allowing us to understand each applicant’s academic potential and character. Families are warmly encouraged to visit the school, explore our historic Edinburgh grounds, and meet members of our exceptional faculty — who are always delighted to answer any questions, big or small. Whether you're enquiring about entry points at age 3, 11, or Sixth Form, our dedicated admissions team is here to guide and support you every step of the way. We look forward to welcoming you to Beckminster Crest.

Enrichment

Our education extends far beyond the classroom through a rich and dynamic enrichment programme designed to develop well-rounded, confident individuals. Students have the opportunity to take part in a wide array of activities including tennis and swimming lessons, cricket club, and chess club, as well as music tuition for those wishing to learn an instrument or join one of our ensembles. A varied calendar of social events, watersports excursions, and cultural trips into Edinburgh — from galleries and museums to live theatre — allows students to explore the world around them and build meaningful friendships. We also host regular talks from distinguished professionals across industries, alongside career planning sessions and mentoring opportunities that help students envision and shape their futures. This extensive programme ensures that every pupil can discover their passions, build lasting confidence, and flourish in all aspects of school life.

Fees for 2025-2026

We offer a flexible and supportive fee structure designed to meet the diverse needs of our families. Pupils may attend as day students, or opt for a variety of boarding arrangements, including two or four nights per week, term-time boarding for Sixth Form students, or our convenient flexi-boarding option, allowing families to book overnight stays on an as-needed basis. Boarding not only provides greater structure and independence, but also fosters confidence, resilience, and social development — qualities that serve students well throughout life. With more time to engage in a wide range of enrichment opportunities, from team sports and chess club to theatre outings and evening study sessions, boarding life at Beckminster Crest is both fulfilling and formative. Full details of tuition and boarding fees are available from our Admissions Office, and we are always happy to discuss which option best suits your family’s needs.

All fees are inclusive of the 20% VAT on school fees where applicable, all costs of term time trips, including residential trips both in the UK and abroad, all meals, towels and laundry whilst boarding as well as hobbies ran by the school staff.

Scholarships

We proudly recognise and reward exceptional talent through our prestigious scholarship programme, available to students aged 12 to 18 who demonstrate outstanding ability in academics, the arts, music, sport, or leadership. Scholarship recipients benefit from a 10% reduction in tuition fees, as well as a range of exclusive privileges, including access to special mentoring, tailored enrichment opportunities, and invitation-only events that further develop their potential. Becoming a Beckminster Crest scholar is both an honour and a responsibility — scholars are celebrated not only for their talents but also for their character, ambition, and positive influence within the school community. Highly competitive and deeply respected, our scholarship programme reflects the school's ongoing commitment to excellence, aspiration, and leadership.
